name: R√©cup√©rer les donn√©es du march√© au comptant MEXC en temps r√©el avec GPT-4.1-mini et Telegram
description:
**Obtenez instantan√©ment des donn√©es du march√© au comptant MEXC en temps r√©el dans Telegram !**

Ce flux de travail connecte l'**API REST v3 de MEXC** avec **Telegram** et un **formatage optionnel GPT-4.1-mini**, fournissant aux utilisateurs les **derniers prix, statistiques sur 24h, profondeur du carnet d'ordres, transactions et chandeliers** dans des messages structur√©s, pr√™ts pour Telegram.

---

## üîé Comment √ßa fonctionne

1. Un n≈ìud **D√©clencheur Telegram** √©coute les commandes.
2. **L'authentification des utilisateurs** garantit que seuls les ID Telegram autoris√©s peuvent acc√©der au bot.
3. Un **ID de session** est g√©n√©r√© √† partir de `chat.id` pour une m√©moire l√©g√®re.
4. L'**Agent IA MEXC** coordonne plusieurs appels API via des n≈ìuds HTTP :

   * **Ticker (Dernier prix)** ‚Üí `/api/v3/ticker/price?symbol=BTCUSDT`
   * **Statistiques sur 24h** ‚Üí `/api/v3/ticker/24hr?symbol=BTCUSDT`
   * **Profondeur du carnet d'ordres** ‚Üí `/api/v3/depth?symbol=BTCUSDT&limit=50`
   * **Meilleure offre/demande instantan√©e** ‚Üí `/api/v3/ticker/bookTicker?symbol=BTCUSDT`
   * **Chandeliers (Klines)** ‚Üí `/api/v3/klines?symbol=BTCUSDT&interval=15m&limit=200`
   * **Transactions r√©centes** ‚Üí `/api/v3/trades?symbol=BTCUSDT&limit=100`
5. Les **n≈ìuds utilitaires** affinent les donn√©es :

   * **Calculateur** ‚Üí √©carts, moyennes, prix moyens.
   * **R√©fl√©chir** ‚Üí formate le JSON brut en r√©sum√©s lisibles par l'homme.
   * **M√©moire simple** ‚Üí sauvegarde le symbole, l'ID de session et le contexte √† travers les tours.
6. **Diviseur de messages** emp√™che les messages Telegram de d√©passer 4000 caract√®res.
7. Les r√©sultats sont renvoy√©s √† **Telegram** dans des rapports structur√©s et lisibles.

---

## ‚úÖ Ce que vous pouvez faire avec cet agent

* Obtenez les **derniers prix et statistiques sur 24h** pour n'importe quelle paire au comptant.
* R√©cup√©rez la **profondeur du carnet d'ordres** (niveaux personnalisables).
* Surveillez les **meilleures offres/demandes** pour les √©carts.
* Consultez les **donn√©es OHLCV des chandeliers** pour plusieurs p√©riodes.
* V√©rifiez les **transactions r√©centes** (jusqu'√† 100).
* Recevez des **rapports Telegram clairs** ‚Äî pas de JSON brut.

---

## üõ†Ô∏è √âtapes de configuration

1. **Cr√©ez un bot Telegram**

   * Utilisez [@BotFather](https://t.me/BotFather) pour cr√©er un bot et copiez son jeton API.

2. **Configurez dans n8n**

   * Importez `MEXC AI Agent v1.02.json`.
   * Mettez √† jour le **n≈ìud d'authentification des utilisateurs** avec votre ID Telegram.
   * Ajoutez les **identifiants API Telegram** (jeton du bot).
   * Ajoutez la **cl√© API OpenAI** 
* (Optionnel) Ajoutez la [cl√© API MEXC](https://www.mexc.com/mexc-api) 

3. **D√©ployez et testez**

   * Activez le flux de travail dans n8n.
   * Envoyez une requ√™te comme `BTCUSDT` √† votre bot.
   * Recevez instantan√©ment des donn√©es structur√©es du march√© au comptant MEXC dans Telegram.

---

## üì§ R√®gles de sortie

* Sortie regroup√©e en **Prix, Statistiques sur 24h, Carnet d'ordres, Chandeliers, Transactions**.
* Pas de JSON brut ‚Äî uniquement des r√©sum√©s format√©s.
* Conforme √† la limite de message de 4000 caract√®res de Telegram (auto-split).

---

## üì∫ Tutoriel vid√©o de configuration

Regardez le guide de configuration complet sur YouTube :

[![Regarder sur YouTube](https://img.youtube.com/vi/x4MZ5SmEPwM/0.jpg)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=x4MZ5SmEPwM)


---

‚ö° **D√©bloquez des informations sur le march√© au comptant MEXC en temps r√©el dans Telegram ‚Äî claires, rapides et sans cl√© API.**

---

### üßæ Licence et attribution

¬© 2025 **Treasurium Capital Limited Company**
L'architecture, les invites et la structure des rapports de trading sont prot√©g√©es par des droits de propri√©t√© intellectuelle.

**Aucun rebranding non autoris√© n'est permis.**

üîó **Pour support :** [Don Jayamaha ‚Äì LinkedIn](https://linkedin.com/in/donjayamahajr)

nodes.name: Splits message is more than 4000 characters

parameters.content:
## Trigger Incoming Telegram Command
Node: Telegram Trigger
**Listens for new Telegram messages** from users.
Triggers the full agent process and passes raw user input downstream.

## Validate User Access
Node: User **Authentication
Checks incoming Telegram ID** against the approved user list.

## Generate Session Metadata
Node: Add S**essionId
Creates a sessionId using the Telegram chat_id**.
This is passed into all downstream tools for memory and workflow routing.

# Main AI Agent: Data Fetcher (MEXC)

**Role:** Fetch and format Spot market data from the official **MEXC REST API**.
The agent retrieves requested data but does **not** analyze, predict, or recommend.

---

## üîó API Access

**Base URL:** `https://api.mexc.com`
**Method:** All requests are **HTTP GET**
**Response:** JSON

---

## üìå Supported Endpoints

* `/api/v3/depth` ‚Üí Order Book Depth
* `/api/v3/ticker/price` ‚Üí Latest Price
* `/api/v3/ticker/bookTicker` ‚Üí Best Bid/Ask
* `/api/v3/klines` ‚Üí Klines (Candlestick Data)
* `/api/v3/avgPrice` ‚Üí Current Average Price
* `/api/v3/ticker/24hr` ‚Üí 24h Stats
* `/api/v3/trades` ‚Üí Recent Trades

## Handle Telegram Message Limits
Node: Code (split logic)
Checks if the **GPT output exceeds 4000 characters**.
If so, it splits the message into safe chunks and passes them on sequentially.

## Send Final Report to Telegram
Node: Telegram sendMessage
Sends **formatted HTML report (or split chunks)** directly to the authenticated user via Telegram bot.

## GPT Model for Reasoning
Node: OpenAI Chat Model
Model: **gpt-4o-mini**
Used to:

Interpret signal values

Generate structured HTML

**Recommend spot and leverage trades**

### **Order Book Depth**

**Endpoint:** `GET /api/v3/depth`
**What it does:** Returns **order book** bids/asks up to `limit`.
**Params:**

* `symbol` (STRING, required)
* `limit` (INT, default 100; max 5000; we default 100)
  **Request weight:** varies by `limit` (1‚Äì100 ‚Üí 5; 101‚Äì500 ‚Üí 25; 501‚Äì1000 ‚Üí 50; 1001‚Äì5000 ‚Üí 250).
  **Returns:** `lastUpdateId`, `bids: [[price, qty], ...]`, `asks: [[price, qty], ...]`
  **n8n query mapping:**

```txt
symbol = $fromAI('parameters0_Value', '', 'string')
limit  = $fromAI('parameters1_Value', 100, 'number')
```

**Notes:** If `limit > 5000`, only 5000 are returned.

### **Best Bid/Ask (Book Ticker)**

**Endpoint:** `GET /api/v3/ticker/bookTicker`
**What it does:** Best **bid/ask** and sizes for the symbol.
**Params:** `symbol` (optional; **we send it**)
**Request weight:** `2` with `symbol`, `4` otherwise.
**Returns:** `{"symbol":"BTCUSDT","bidPrice":"...","bidQty":"...","askPrice":"...","askQty":"..."}`
**n8n query mapping:**

```txt
symbol = $fromAI('parameters0_Value', '', 'string')
```

**Notes:** Great for quick spread snapshot.

## Short-Term Memory Module
Node: **Simple Memory
Stores the sessionId**, symbol, and other state data.
Useful for:

Multi-turn Telegram interactions

Tracking indicator agreement across timeframes

### **24h Stats**

**Endpoint:** `GET /api/v3/ticker/24hr`
**What it does:** 24-hour rolling window stats for a symbol: **open/high/low/last**, **volume**, **quoteVolume**, **% change**, etc.
**Params:**

* `symbol` (STRING, optional but we send it)
  **Request weight:** `2` with one `symbol`; heavier without or with many symbols.
  **Returns (FULL):** priceChange, priceChangePercent, weightedAvgPrice, openPrice, highPrice, lowPrice, lastPrice, volume, quoteVolume, openTime, closeTime, firstId, lastId, count.
  **n8n query mapping:**

```txt
symbol = $fromAI('parameters0_Value', '', 'string')
```

**Notes:** This is MEXC‚Äôs 24h rolling stats endpoint.

### **Price (Latest)**

**Endpoint:** `GET /api/v3/ticker/price`
**What it does:** Returns the **latest trade price** for a symbol.
**Params:** `symbol` (STRING, optional for all symbols; **we send it**)
**Request weight:** `2` with `symbol` (otherwise `4`).
**Returns:** `{"symbol":"BTCUSDT","price":"..."}`
**n8n query mapping:**

```txt
symbol = $fromAI('parameters0_Value', '', 'string')
```

**Notes:** Use UPPERCASE symbols without `-` or `/` (e.g., `BTCUSDT`).

### **Klines (Candles)**

**Endpoint:** `GET /api/v3/klines`
**What it does:** Candlestick bars for a symbol/interval.
**Params:**

* `symbol` (STRING, required)
* `interval` (ENUM, required ‚Äî e.g., `1m,3m,5m,15m,30m,1h,2h,4h,6h,8h,12h,1d,3d,1w,1M`)
* `limit` (INT, default 500, max 1000 ‚Äî **we set 20**)
* `startTime`, `endTime` (optional)
  **Request weight:** `1`.
  **Returns (array per candle):** `[ openTime, open, high, low, close, volume, closeTime, quoteAssetVolume, numberOfTrades, takerBuyBaseVolume, takerBuyQuoteVolume ]`
  **n8n query mapping:**

```txt
symbol  = $fromAI('parameters0_Value', '', 'string')
interval= $fromAI('parameters1_Value', '15m', 'string')
limit   = $fromAI('parameters2_Value', 20, 'number')
```

**Notes:** Without `startTime/endTime`, returns most recent.

### **Average Price**

**Endpoint:** `GET /api/v3/avgPrice`
**What it does:** **Current average price** for a symbol (rolling window).
**Params:** `symbol` (STRING, required)
**Request weight:** `1`.
**Returns:** `{"mins":5,"price":"...","closeTime":...}`
**n8n query mapping:**

```txt
symbol = $fromAI('parameters0_Value', '', 'string')
```

**Notes:** Use UPPERCASE trading pairs without `-` (e.g., `BTCUSDT`).

### üè∑ Tool: **Recent Trades**

**Endpoint:** `GET /api/v3/trades`
**What it does:** Returns the **most recent public trades** for a symbol on MEXC.

**Params:**
* `symbol` (STRING, required)
* `limit`  (INT, optional; default 100, max 1000)

**Returns:** array of trades like `{ id, price, qty, quoteQty, time, isBuyerMaker, isBestMatch }`.

**n8n query mapping:**
```txt
symbol = $fromAI('parameters0_Value', '', 'string')
limit  = $fromAI('parameters1_Value', 100, 'number')
```

**Notes:** For older historical trades, use the exchange's historical endpoint if available.

parameters.description:
### üè∑ Tool: **Think**

**Purpose:**

* Lightweight **reasoning helper**.
* Lets the AI Agent process intermediate logic, format outputs, or decide how to combine multiple API results before sending the final report.
* Does not fetch data itself.

**Use cases:**

* Clean/reshape JSON from Binance endpoints
* Extract only the needed fields (e.g., `lastPrice`, `volume`)
* Help prepare data for Telegram message formatting

**n8n setup notes:**

* No API call, just an **AI Tool** node.
* Connect upstream API results ‚Üí Think ‚Üí Report Agent.

parameters.content:
### **Calculator**

**Purpose:**

* Perform **math operations** inside the workflow.
* Supports add/subtract/multiply/divide, percentages, rounding, etc.

**Use cases:**

* Calculate spreads (ask ‚Äì bid)
* Compute % changes from open vs. last price
* Normalize volumes or confidence scores

**n8n setup notes:**

* Node: `Calculator` (n8n built-in)
* Input fields can come from Binance API JSON
* Output can be chained into Think ‚Üí Final Report

### **Think**

**Purpose:**

* Lightweight **reasoning helper**.
* Lets the AI Agent process intermediate logic, format outputs, or decide how to combine multiple API results before sending the final report.
* Does not fetch data itself.

**Use cases:**

* Clean/reshape JSON from Binance endpoints
* Extract only the needed fields (e.g., `lastPrice`, `volume`)
* Help prepare data for Telegram message formatting

**n8n setup notes:**

* No API call, just an **AI Tool** node.
* Connect upstream API results ‚Üí Think ‚Üí Report Agent.

options.systemMessage:
You are the **MEXC Spot Market Data Agent**.

You have **HTTP request access** to the official **MEXC REST API** to retrieve market data for any requested Spot trading pair.
Your role is to **fetch and present raw market data only**. You do **not** analyze, predict, or recommend.

---

## üîó API Access

**Base endpoint (Spot API):**

* `https://api.mexc.com`

**Format rules:**

* All requests are **HTTP GET**
* Responses are **JSON**
* Parameters use query strings (e.g., `?symbol=BTCUSDT&limit=100`)
* `symbol` is always uppercase, no `/` or `-` (e.g., `BTCUSDT`)

---

## üìå Available Market Data Endpoints

1. **24h Stats**
   `GET /api/v3/ticker/24hr?symbol=BTCUSDT`
   ‚Ä¢ Returns 24h open, high, low, last, % change, volume, quote volume, etc.

2. **Order Book Depth**
   `GET /api/v3/depth?symbol=BTCUSDT&limit=100`
   ‚Ä¢ Returns top bids/asks with quantities.

3. **Latest Symbol Price**
   `GET /api/v3/ticker/price?symbol=BTCUSDT`
   ‚Ä¢ Returns the latest trade price.

4. **Order Book Best Bid/Ask**
   `GET /api/v3/ticker/bookTicker?symbol=BTCUSDT`
   ‚Ä¢ Returns best bid/ask with sizes.

5. **Kline / Candlestick Data**
   `GET /api/v3/klines?symbol=BTCUSDT&interval=15m&limit=20`
   ‚Ä¢ Returns OHLCV data for supported intervals.

6. **Current Average Price**
   `GET /api/v3/avgPrice?symbol=BTCUSDT`
   ‚Ä¢ Returns rolling average price.

7. **Recent Trades**
   `GET /api/v3/trades?symbol=BTCUSDT&limit=100`
   ‚Ä¢ Most recent trades (id, price, qty, time, isBuyerMaker, etc.).

---

## üß© Utility Tools

* **Calculator** ‚Üí Perform math (spreads, % changes, ratios).
* **Think** ‚Üí Lightweight reasoning helper for restructuring JSON, selecting fields, and preparing outputs.

---

## üì§ Output Format

* Output must be **structured, clean, and human-readable**.
* Group data logically (Price, 24h Stats, Order Book, Klines, Trades).
* Do **not** output raw JSON.
* Do **not** include HTML unless explicitly required by workflow.

---

## ‚ö†Ô∏è Rules

* Always use the **correct API endpoint**.
* Do **not fabricate values**.
* Do **not provide trading advice or predictions**.
* If data is missing or request fails, return `N/A`.

parameters.toolDescription:
### üè∑ Tool: **24h Stats**

**Endpoint:** `GET /api/v3/ticker/24hr`
**What it does:** 24-hour rolling window stats for a symbol: **open/high/low/last**, **volume**, **quoteVolume**, **% change**, etc.
**Params:**

* `symbol` (STRING, optional but we send it)
  **Request weight:** `2` with one `symbol`; heavier without or with many symbols.
  **Returns (FULL):** priceChange, priceChangePercent, weightedAvgPrice, openPrice, highPrice, lowPrice, lastPrice, volume, quoteVolume, openTime, closeTime, firstId, lastId, count.
  **n8n query mapping:**

```txt
symbol = $fromAI('parameters0_Value', '', 'string')
```

**Notes:** This is MEXC‚Äôs 24h rolling stats endpoint.

### üè∑ Tool: **Order Book Depth**

**Endpoint:** `GET /api/v3/depth`

### üè∑ Tool: **Klines (Candles)**

**Endpoint:** `GET /api/v3/klines`
**What it does:** Candlestick bars for a symbol/interval.
**Params:**

* `symbol` (STRING, required)
* `interval` (ENUM, required ‚Äî e.g., `1m,3m,5m,15m,30m,1h,2h,4h,6h,8h,12h,1d,3d,1w,1M`)
* `limit` (INT, default 500, max 1000 ‚Äî **we set 20**)
* `startTime`, `endTime` (optional)
  **Request weight:** `1`.
  **Returns (array per candle):** `[ openTime, open, high, low, close, volume, closeTime, quoteAssetVolume, numberOfTrades, takerBuyBaseVolume, takerBuyQuoteVolume ]`
  **n8n query mapping:**

```txt
symbol  = $fromAI('parameters0_Value', '', 'string')
interval= $fromAI('parameters1_Value', '15m', 'string')
limit   = $fromAI('parameters2_Value', 20, 'number')
```

**Notes:** Without `startTime/endTime`, returns most recent.

### üè∑ Tool: **Average Price**

**Endpoint:** `GET /api/v3/avgPrice`
**What it does:** **Current average price** for a symbol (rolling window).
**Params:** `symbol` (STRING, required)
**Request weight:** `1`.
**Returns:** `{"mins":5,"price":"...","closeTime":...}`


### üè∑ Tool: **Recent Trades**

**Endpoint:** `GET /api/v3/trades`
**What it does:** Returns the **most recent public trades** for a symbol on MEXC.

**Params:**
* `symbol` (STRING, required)
* `limit`  (INT, optional; default 100, max 1000)

**Returns:** array of trades like `{ id, price, qty, quoteQty, time, isBuyerMaker, isBestMatch }`.

**n8n query mapping:**
```txt
symbol = $fromAI('parameters0_Value', '', 'string')
limit  = $fromAI('parameters1_Value', 100, 'number')
```

**Notes:** For older historical trades, use the exchange's historical endpoint if available.

parameters.content: # üß† MEXC Spot Market Quant AI Agent ‚Äì Full System Documentation A dedicated AI automation system for **spot market analysis** on MEXC. It integrates **price feeds, order book data, and 24h statistics**, processes structured inputs via n8n, and generates **Telegram-ready trading summaries**. --- ## üß© Included Workflows You must install and activate **all of the following workflows** for this system to function: | ‚úÖ Workflow Name | üìå Function Description | | ------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------ | | MEXC Spot Market Quant AI Agent | Core orchestrator. Handles user queries and generates the final market report. | | MEXC Price & Order Data Tool | Fetches **latest price**, **24h stats**, and **order book depth** from MEXC. | | MEXC Kline Tool | Pulls OHLCV candles for multiple intervals (15m, 1h, 4h, 1d). | | MEXC Recent Trades Tool | Fetches recent executed trades for selected trading pairs. | --- ## ‚öôÔ∏è Installation Instructions ### Step 1: Import Workflows * Open your **n8n Editor UI** * Import each JSON file (from this package) * Save and activate workflows ### Step 2: Configure Credentials * **OpenAI API Credential** ‚Üí Add your GPT-4 key * **MEXC Price/Order/Kline APIs** ‚Üí Public endpoints, **no authentication required** ### Step 3: Webhook Setup * Ensure the AI Agent workflow can be triggered from your **Telegram bot** or internal webhook call * If using Telegram, add your **Telegram Bot API Token** in n8n credentials --- ## üñ•Ô∏è System Workflow Overview ``` [Telegram/Webhook Trigger] ‚Üí [Session Memory + Prompt Parsing] ‚Üí [MEXC Spot Market Quant AI Agent] ‚Üí [Price & 24h Stats Tool] ‚Üí [Order Book Depth Tool] ‚Üí [Klines (OHLCV) Tool] ‚Üí [Recent Trades Tool] ‚Üí [Reasoning + Report Formatter] ‚Üí [Telegram/Output Channel] ``` --- ## üì¨ Telegram Output Example ```html MEXC: BTC/USDT Market Report Spot Strategy ‚Ä¢ Action: Buy ‚Ä¢ Entry: $63,820 | SL: $61,200 | TP: $66,500 ‚Ä¢ Reason: ‚Äì Strong 4h MACD Bullish Signal ‚Äì 24h Volume Spike ‚Äì Order book shows strong bid walls Market Data ‚Ä¢ Last Price: $63,820 ‚Ä¢ 24h Change: +3.2% ‚Ä¢ 24h Volume: 18,200 BTC ‚Ä¢ Spread: 0.02% Recent Trades: ‚Ä¢ Buy-side dominant (62%) ``` --- ## üöÄ Support & Licensing üîó **Don Jayamaha ‚Äì LinkedIn** [linkedin.com/in/donjayamahajr](http://linkedin.com/in/donjayamahajr) ¬© 2025 Treasurium Capital Limited Company. All rights reserved. This system architecture, prompts, and workflow structure are proprietary and protected by **U.S. copyright law**. Reuse or resale prohibited without license.

data.details: The Code node allows you to execute JavaScript in your workflow.
